article_title: Fidelity's Profit Up 13% as Outflows Decline
article_text:
Fidelity Investments, the Boston-based asset manager and discount brokerage, said the operating income of its financial services business rose 13% to $2.6 billion, though investors continued to pull money from the company's stock and bond mutual funds.

Investors pulled a net $7.8 billion from Fidelity's stock products in 2013, even as the rest of the industry saw substantial inflows into such funds. Last year, U.S. stock mutual funds and exchange-traded funds overall garnered more than $172 billion from investors,...
